review: So this for all the people with terrible anxiety like me. Don't read the reviews to freak out. If you NEED to read them to prepare yourself do it. So I got prescribed these for a UTI, 2 tablets a day/7 days. Perfect, fine. Took about 3 days to start working and now I feel generally okay, sorta burns in the morning but its whatever. Well the only side effects that is noticeable are terrible indigestion that tums don’t help, some light nausea (subsided with a probiotic) and anxiety. I generally have situational anxiety so I was shocked as to why I was having daily panic attacks and overwhelming anxiety almost all day long until I realized it was certainly Bactrim. Macrobid gave me awful migraines so this is a step in the better direction. Take it, some side effects are better than a kidney infection! Just make sure your dr does a culture & a drug resistance test on your urine so it works!

i started taking bactrim for my uti last week. It has made everything worse. I literally feel like I'm dying and I'm puking every morning. The side effects are worse so that I would much rather sit through the pain of a UTI then deal with this.

Please remember when reading reviews, people seldom come back to review if their experience was good. I would like to ease some peoples minds. Of course everyone’s body is different but Bactrim DS 800/160 is my favorite UTI medication. I have minimal side effects. I take each pill with food and a full bottle of water. I experience headaches & that’s about it. Occasionally I will feel kinda just off. But nothing crazy. I'd take the side effects vs. a UTI any day. Please at least give it a try and remember that anxiety can cause side effects itself. I also get nervous when trying a medication. However, a UTI can’t go untreated. Wishing you all the best.

Remember, you are taking this medicine to heal, to protect yourself from any worse infection. This is my second time on bactrim, I took two doses (160/80 mg)  for each day for a week. I had no side effects besides a bit of photosensitivity and a little upset stomach. Towards the end I started to get a big headache and a little pressure, but it went away. Like most people, the other reviews made me very scared, however, everyone’s experience is different, don’t let that discourage you! Unless you’re allergic to sulfa drugs, this won’t hurt you, it will help you! I hope this helps anyone who is a bit hesitant about taking this, I totally understand what you’re going through, just have the courage to push through and take care of your body!
I had zero side effects which I was very surprised about considering all the other comments. It cured my UTI right away and I feel great!

This stuff is nightmare fuel. I’m on the third day, my UTI is still lingering and I feel worse than I’ve felt in a long time. Constant headache, weak, shaky, anxious, DIZZY, itchy??? And the diarrhea is just a fun little bonus. I would say if you’re highly sensitive to medications like I am, and you’re taking this stuff for a UTI, go and get a urine test to make sure Bactrim is the right stuff for you. Do not take this unless it’s your only option. I’m sure for those with sturdier constitutions this stuff is fine, but I’m not one of those people and I feel horrible.

UTI came back after taking Macrobid, which was somehow more gentle to me. Started this about a week and a half later. Cleared it up again, but the only problem is I'm having is constipation and these are horse pills. YOU NEED TO EAT WITH ANTIBIOTICS!!! And drink plenty of water to flush your infection out. Not soda, not coffee, WATER. But from my experience, the harshest antibiotic was Cipro. Macrobid the gentlest, but didn't work. And I guess Bactrim is in the middle. Just my input.

I received a kidney transplant and have been on Bactrim the entire time. I just found out it was to help me from getting UTI’s but it didn’t work at all. This whole year I have had them every other month. I have had zero side effects with this medication and I was on about 15-20 different medications when I first received the transplant.
Worst drug I have ever taken. Was prescribed for UTI. Like an hour after taking I got extreme chest pains and my heart rate dropped to the low 40/30s. Extreme fatigue.

I was really nervous to take this mediation due to reviews. I’m prescribed it twice a day for 3 days. Going on day 3 tomorrow and absolutely no side effects from the drug! Very pleased with it. Try not to look too much into it like I did. This medication is being prescribed to you for a reason!

it worked and did its job in stopping my UTI pretty quickly but at the same time I was subjected to some of the worst side effects I've ever had. I was having terrible constipation and bloating and I couldn't sleep some nights from the pounding headaches and nausea. To add insult to injury, on the last day of taking it, I had a delayed allergic reaction to sulfa. This stuff was worse than my actual UTI.  Please ask for any other antibiotic.

I was prescribed this for my UTI which was moderate (>100,000 CFU/ML R. Coli. I have had mild to moderate generalized anxiety disorder since I was 19 years old and have kept it pretty controlled and then I took this medication. I agree, my anxiety was very heightened, jittery, heart pounding, hot even though I had my air conditioner on high and did not feel like this prior to being on the medication.  I’m on day three of seven, and according to the literature three days should be sufficient so guess what, this is my last day. My infection is much much better so I know the drug is doing its job very well.  If you have any type of generalized anxiety disorder even if it is managed, I would not recommend Bactrim. Being a nurse, I am not one to start medication’s at all but this one is just too much. I get in front of people and get presentations on a daily basis and there is no way I’m going to be able to get up and do my job without having a panic attack while on this med.

Male 59 and NEVER had UTI. Still not sure how I got it but e coli was positive.  Took  nitrofurantoin for 10 days. Went away but reoccur in 3 days. GCP gave me Bactrim ds for 10 days, #20. Test was negative and has never returned. Worked for me. Side effects were kind of like a bloated feeling but thats it. Not sure about all the horror stories here i've been reading here.

Found this site as I was taking my first Bactrim dose and was concerned about side affects. The first day didn't feel great but I didn't attribute that to the medication. I took med with food, before and after and felt key was to drink a lot of water to flush system.  I cut back on coffee intake as well. Completed all meds with no side effects. It cleared the UTI up quickly.

Awful!! Had a 5 day/10 pill prescription of bactrim for a UTI. Just thought I was lethargic the first day, but later that night my hands were shaking, heart beating fast, which induced a full anxiety attack. Kept taking the pills. Fast forward to day 4 and my head was so foggy I felt like I was a walking zombie and the shakes got so bad I had to go to urgent care. No appetite what-so-ever. Cleared up the UTI but avoid at all costs!!

Had what I suspected was a bladder infection that unfortunately I ignored and forgot about for 10 days, with symptoms that more closely lined up with a kidney infection. I've had many UTIs in the last year and one earlier this year. I've taken Bactrim for them before with no issue. Took a home UTI test to confirm suspicions of infection. Consulted a virtual doctor (can't get to an office because exposure to covid). And they prescribed Bactrim twice a day for 3 days. Took all the pills but symptoms came back at 5 am on the last day. (Took last dose of initial round at 11pm) Took another home test and showed trace of infection remained.  Didn't know what to do, so I got ahold of the doctor again and requested an extension of the medication. 1 dose in and waiting to see if things improve.

I was authorized to take Bactrim 2 pills a day for 5 days, to cure my UTI . This by far has been the worst side effects I’ve ever experienced while taking antibiotics. I did eat right before taking the pills and I got terrible nausea, light headed spells and muscle cramps. I drank plenty of water to help dissolve the meds that was all that seemed to subside if for a little while.

Took sulfamethoxazole with trimethoprim for a minor testicular infection. I got very sick. It caused chest pain, shortness of breath, severe headache and sharp pains all over my body. The doctor told me it was in my head and I kept taking it. I eventually ended up in hospital and was so sick I could barely sleep. It’s been a month since I took this drug and while some of the problems are gone, I still have very bad muscle weakness, cramping in my legs, and sharp pains that feel like nerve damage, I’ve seen many doctors all agree that bactrim did something to my system. I urge you do not take this drug, I haven’t had any response from my doctor since I called with all my symptoms. It has gotten so severe I’m starting to think my life might never be the same and I was completely health, 21 year old before this. DO NOT TAKE THIS.

I took one pill in the evening and another the following morning.  I developed extreme stomach pain by noon which moved to my back followed by an excruciating headache.  I was nauseous but sipped tiny amounts of water to prevent dehydration. was very weak for two days, my hands trembled.  Horrible experience.
Not sure if it’s from Bactrim, but my last day of taking bactrim I started feeling faint and dizzy and nauseous with diarrhea.. 5 days later and I’m still feeling dizzy.

Took Bactrim for UTI for 7 days. On 6th day had chills and  body aches. Literally could not get off the couch. Went to dr and negative for flu and UTI was gone. Got worse (headache, severe body aches, nausea, diarrhea, no appetite--honestly the worst I've EVER felt) and ended up in the ER for fluids. Stopped taking it 2 days ago and still feeling effects. Be careful--wished I had stopped taking it at the first sign of stomach discomfort. Glad it's a reliable drug for some but for me it was horrid.

I was prescribed this drug for a bladder infection. Took it’s Thursday night I was fine all day Friday. I have an Apple Watch so I did notice my heart rate was higher, but was busy at work so didn’t really pay attention till day 3 felt better as far as the bladder infection. But had the worst headache and anxiety and my pulse was 134 normally like 84 I was very anxious called my doctor and was told to stop taking it. I stopped and today the next day my pulse is back to normal and headache is gone. It helped clear up my infection... I mean besides the heart racing it did it’s job.

This is the second time for me that this has been prescribed for a UTI. The side effects are beyond terrible. Every joint in my body ached, major fatigue, rash, eyes very bloodshot.  The worst thing though was the dry , cracked lips, and loss of mucus  membranes in vulvar, vaginal area. I have never heard of this kind of side effect and neither did the urologist.  This has happened both times I was on Bactrim.  I stopped taking it and never will again.

Was told at doctor's office that I had a urinary tract infection so was put on Bactrim. Forgot that I had been on it a couple of years ago for same thing. Had the same reaction as I did before. Continuous stomach upset and severe itching. Even though I was taking it with food and drinking plenty of water. Took first dose Friday evening last dose was Tuesday morning. One pill twice a day for four days. Last time it took more than a month to finally get my stomach to quit feeling upset and to quit itching. Not looking forward to this again. Will definitely remember to tell the doctor not to put me on it again. However, it did clear up the infection!

The doctor thought I had a possible UTI so he prescribed me Bactrim. The first 2 days were fine, the third day I had extremely bad leg cramps, my hands were cramping so bad, my body was aching my head was tingling, heart racing. I felt like I was going to pass out. I went to urgent care and they took a blood test and my vitals. They said everything was fine but told me to stop taking bactrim. Never again.
Getting relief from the pain of a kidney infection far outweighed the side effects.

Can’t sleep for more than 2/3 hours at a time even after taking melatonin. Pretty severe nausea and even worse restlessness. Seems to be working for the UTI but at the cost of side effects which are leaving me exhausted and bed ridden with no energy.

Bactrim DS taken twice a day has been effective for each UTI I’ve had. It covers a resistant strain of E.Coli and has been effective all times I’ve taken it. I just make sure to eat a meal prior to taking it and I’m fine.

Took 3 days of Cipro - UTI symptoms continued.  Put on Bactrim and initially the symptoms started improving.  But by 3rd day I could no longer eat - the nausea was terrible.  Chills.  Exhausted but couldn’t sleep due to heart palpitations.  Finally started vomiting.  Decided that the side effects far out-weighed the benefits of this particular drug.

I was on Bactrim for 7 days for a UTI infection. It cleared it up and didn't seem to have many problems until the last one I took. I broke out in hives itching everywhere and I thought I was going to die. I still feel horrible from taking it , with a loss of appetite and anxiety. I will never take this again, as I am now allergic to it.  It is now 7 days since I took in and I still feel awful.

I started Bactrum DS /Septra DS  I took 1 tablet on a Wednesday too late  in the day to take a second .  I was fine until Saturday then the nausea started which is horrible I just hope I don't have any other  reactions .

I had commented on here before about my use of bactrim Ds. It's been 2 weeks since my last does and I STILL have weakness and dizziness. I'll have to go to the doctor sometimes soon. This is my first antibiotic ever. I'm scared to find out whats wrong but my urine has cleared up...
I have been on it one day and was really scared to take it because of all the negative reviews. I will update when I have completed the course in four more days.  So far so good.....
Bactrim DS for bladder infection and now my vagina on fire and red splotches on my face..no bueno!!!

I thought I had UTI doctor put me onthe antibiotic  bactrim DS.  By the third day I thought I was having heart attack heart palpitations were so bad doctor called took me off meds.  Apparently I  did not have UTI instead I had kidney stone. The problem now is heart palpitations never got better when I stopped the bactrim and its 5 months later. Some days are so bad with palpitations  and have trouble breathing when it happens have jidders when it happens I hope it goes away soon horrible feeling I will never take it again
Bactrim was not effective at all for my UTI. After 3 days of suffering I switched to Cipro which worked.

I took  Bactrim  2 X a day for 3 days for a UTI. I did experience some strange side effects but it knocked the UTI out in 24 hrs. My skin felt warm and itchy and I was very sun sensitive. I was very edgy with my husband and son and had difficulty falling asleep the last night. Glad I'm done with them but overall I feel it was worth it to get rid of the UTI.

3 days of Bactrim DS for a UTI. The only problem I had was fatigue. I took the pill with a good amount of food, and also used Monistat while I was taking it.  Also had asked my doc for diflucan for post treatment.  I’m waiting for the Bactrim to completely leave my system before taking the 1 diflucan pill.  Also, I took a molybdenum supplement while taking Bactrim.  Some people react to sulphur because they are deficient in molybdenum, which helps process it.  Finally, took a good amount of probiotics which I will continue for awhile.

I was prescribed Bactrim for my UTI, 2 times a day for 3 days. The first day I have A LOT of confusion. By the second day I was having horrible headaches, have, loss of appetite and a stiff neck. Now I’m terrified to take my last dose tonight. To my knowledge it appears the medication is working however, I don’t intend to ever take it again. I hope the side effects will stop once I finish my dosage. I would look around before trying this one.

Took four pills out of six Bactrim that I was prescribed for my UTI. It took a while before the side effects kicked in. I got a rash around my neck, down my back and down my chest, Red splotches under my tongue, a terrible sore throat, neck stiffness, skipped heart beats, blisters on my lips, tenderness on hands and feet, which turned into tiny blisters on hands and feet and a few others on legs, arms and ears.  Also, very thirsty. In one day I drank 40oz of water and never felt the need to pee. After 80oz I still had cotton mouth and peed only twice, had dark urine.

I was put on Bactrim for a UTI. This did not work for me after 5 doses, 800mg. I felt like I had just had a baby I was so very sore. Nauseous,  tired, headache (possibly from not sleeping well on it). Amoxicillin always worked for me, I wish my dr would listen to me. I know my body.

This Bactrim stuff is awful!!! Taking for a UTI. I am used to taking cipro, but have stopped due to the nasty side effects of that one. Have been taking the Bactrim for the UTIs instead.Every time I take this stuff I feel weak and dizzy, my head hurts so bad, and I get antsy and stir crazy. I don't want to eat or sleep and the nausea can be overwhelming. This stuff makes me feel like I am going to fade away and die.Once the medication wears off I feel much better, but then its time to take another dose and it starts all over again. Ugh!!!It gets rid of the painful infection, but my I just feel so awful while I am on this stuff.

Was prescribed bactrim for UTI when first med did not work. 3rd day in feeling better until 2nd dose taken. Began to feel nausea dizzy fatigue terrible anxiety unable to sleep or relax. Felt like I was going crazy. Also had constipation back and stomach pain as well. Almost went to ER.  This med is horrible. Never again!

I did experience some of the side effects associated with this medication, Headaches and asthma flare up (manageable). The benefit of the antibiotic far out weighs the side effects of the medication. I would definitely use it again if ever prescribed.

Taking it now for a UTI. I was on Macrobid (nitrofurantoin) for a day or so first and woke up with chills, fever and vomiting. Doc said she thought I was having a negative reaction to the med so switched to Bactrim. This is working on the infection but I've got extreme dizziness and fatigue as side effects. I have a history of having trouble with antibiotics, however--can't take penicillin or any of the cillins, due to reacting with hives. Had a bad reaction to Doxycycline and/or Metronidazole last year (itchy "bruises" formed on my limbs). Obviously now nitrofurantoin is also off the menu. So I'm going with Bactrim because at least I'm not having flu-like symptoms with it. They say about one in 15 people has issues with antibiotics. I'm the one!

1. Don't drink alcohol with Bactrim. 2. Eat a half hour before you take the pill. 3. Drink plenty of water with it. 4. Take an anti-gas pill if needed. About 30 minutes after 1st dose My scalp was tingly & warm. Like a cap was squeezing head. Used ice pack, repeated a few hrs later; it helped. (worried about hives.) Stomach mildly upset. Insomnia. First pill with lots of water 1 p.m.; ate 20" later. Second dose, ate slice bread with pill. Had severe gas (some trapped), burping; hours later took gas pill. (Really, don't wait like I did!)Next morning, still felt sick. Mildly short of breath overnight & part of the morning; unsure if med-caused or just stress from being over-tired. I take a 24-hr claritin, also had 12-hr Sudafed in system when started Bactrim. Severely stuffed up nose after Sudafed wore off; new pill took hours to work.   Bactrim relieved UTI symptoms within hours. Before prescribing, doc cultured to find specific bacteria & it's drug susceptibilities.
This worked great for my UTI.  It does cause some fatigue though.

Have been struggling with UTIs despite my many and varied preventive measures. Had some back up Bactrim that I tried instead of the Augmentin I was prescribed. On both occasions within a half hour I was in MASSIVE EXTREME discomfort, my vagina was on fire. I assumed I had developed a curiously fast yeast infection and treated it that way but with little success. Having done some research I now see it’s a less common but real side effect, similar to a swollen tongue or hives the vagina is the area affected. Lesson learned but terrible that this side effect isn’t mentioned more commonly, a nightmare.

It almost killed me. I took 2 doses. The pain that went from my waist down to my ankles were unmanageable. I ended up in the hospital and my legs completely gave out from the pain. They said I was having such a rare reaction that they didn’t even know how to treat it. It was the scariest thing I’ve been through.

Fought a uti for over a week and finally gave up and went to the doctor earlier today. He prescribed Bactrim DS twice a day for 10 days and within an hour of my first dose the pain was gone. I’d hardly been able to leave the bathroom for almost a full day and all it took was one pill for me not to be absolutely miserable.  I was an idiot for waiting and have had no unpleasant side effects.

Have had 6 UTI’s over the course of 9 months.  Took this medication once for the first one knocked me on my rear made me feel very sick like the flu.  It did clear it up.  Than put on different antibiotics for the other UTI’s and the diarrhea it caused was unbearable.  This time had to go to ER a lot of blood in urine was pretty sick.  They gave me Bactrim and taking for 7 days still have another 7 days.  Makes me very tired and my eyes have been very itchy and swollen.  But it is clearing up infection.  Going to have to stop taking cannot stand the itchy eyes fatigue and weakness plus headache.

I promised that if I had a decent experience with this antibiotic I would write about it. You will not have any of these scary reactions if you are not allergic or are taking a medication that will interact with this. I have anxiety so I know how it feels to read horrible reviews about meds, but the bactrim worked great for my UTI.

Have taken Bactrim for frequent UTIs in the past with no side effects.  Last night I took the first dose of Bactrim DS for yet another UTI; within 10 min. my vaginal area & lips were itching.  Took antihistamine & went to bed.  This morning my lower lip is very swollen/red, eyes are bloodshot, & have a round red rash on my upper arm.  As the morning continued I felt major flu-like symptoms: chills, fatique, muscle/joint pain, headache - like death warmed over.  Took aspirin for the pain and went to bed until the intense cold feeling left.  The symptoms have abated except for the swollen lip, itchy eyes, and red rash.  No idea why I had a reaction this time but will discuss it with my Dr.  UTIs are bad enough without then getting very ill from the med.

I will never take Bactrim again, despite the fact that it appears to have cleaned up my UTI.  I was prescribed 6 pills, 2 per day for 3 days.  By pill #2, I lost my appetite, and felt very weak and tired.  Went to bed very early.  As I continued the medication, I developed many flu-like symptoms, and spent the next 4 days in bed.  Chills, achiness, lethargy, listlessness, extreme tiredness, brain fog, inability to stand up for very long without feeling woozy, not even able to sit up and do light work indoors.  This medication had me flat in bed for 4 days straight.  Two days after finishing the medication, I have still not regained my strength completely, although I am starting to normalize.  I am typically a very active person, who works outdoors every day.  This one threw me for a loop - never again! I will ask for something else for a UTI.
Bactrim doesn't work nor Cipro to clear up my UTI.

This is not my first round of Bactrim. I have chronic UTIs a I've taken this a half dozen times in the key two years. This time I got a side effect I've never had before. Insomnia. I am so awake and have been for three days now. Yes, it does clear the infection for me. I do get the upset tummy which is very common.

I would give this a 0 if I could :This was absolutely horrible I have had a breathing problem since I started it,  I got it Monday night took one pill with a full glass of water and had a small meal due to not having an appetite, I  waited 2 hours to lay down when I laid down to try tried to sleep I just couldn't when I would close my eyes it's like my brain wouldn't shut off.  So I stayed up til 3 in the morning slept for a little bit then got up I had a headache after I laid back down but it went away.  The next day I felt ok but still having a hard time breathing , I was confused at first but it went away,  so I have been dealing with this for 3 days I went into see my doctor and she took me off it and prescribed something else  to help with the  "UTI" And a steroid for my chest, I have not had an appetite for the past 3 days. I would be careful with this drug and if you don't have to take it then don't.

I've had multiple UTI'S in my life so I know what it feels like when I'm getting one. Tuesday night I had symptoms so I went to the doctor the morning after. Got prescribed Bactrim DS. I did what everyone shouldn't do and googled reviews. I was sooo scared to take it  but I felt 100% fine. I was a little dizzy when I first took it but I honestly think that it was all in my head. This is the only medicine I take for UTI'S. I suggest taking it with food to prevent nausea.  But no dizziness. No nausea. No fever. And my infection feels better already.

I was diagnosed on a Tuesday with a UTI. Prescribed Bactrim. As of Thursday, I felt great. But Friday, not so much. I had a bad headache, and my throat began to feel sore. I continued taking the Bactrim. It's now Sunday night, and I feel unbelievably bad. My throat feels like it did when I had tonsillitis, my head feels like it weighs 600lbs. and my energy is flu-like. I called my doc on call, and wait to hear about next steps, but after seeing all the other people who've gone through hell with it, I WILL NOT TAKE ANY MORE OF THIS DRUG. BE WARNED!!!!!

Bactrim didn’t really work for me, it stopped the blood in my urine, but I don’t feel like it killed the infection(e.coli), because I still go pee a lot especially during the night (which makes me sleep only about 3 hours) and it takes me about 10+ seconds to start.The only side effects I experienced were nausea, insomnia and headaches. Wouldn’t recommend this drug.
Had a UTI last month and had 5 day treatment with Septra eased off the symptoms slightly but didn't clear the infection.
Bactrim is the worst. Anytime I get on it, it makes me nauseous sick to my stomach, headache, trapped in the bed and regardless if i finish or not, it does not take the UTI away!

Took Bactrim DS for a UTI two doses daily for three days.   Did the trick.  No major side effects,  maybe a slight headache and a little light headed a couple of times.  However, not awful and most likely from my sinuses.  I am normally sensitive to meds and was afraid after reviews, but no problems.  I would take it again.

Batrim did not work to cure my UTI. Two doctors visits (because he didn’t listen to me when I said Bactrim doesn’t work for me) and two rounds of antibiotics later it was fixed. Cipro. Cipro is the only thing that fixes mine. I don’t know why Batrim doesn’t work on me, but it doesn’t.

NP prescribed bactrim bc I had back-to-back UTIs. Unfortunately, I have an extremely severe allergy to bactrim that I was not aware of. However this allergy  DID NOT SHOW SYMPTOMS UNTIL I HAD BEEN TAKING IT FOR 6 DAYS. I went to the ER because I was developing a red rash and my throat and tongue were swelling up. THE ER DOCTOR TURNED ME AWAY BECAUSE HE THOUGHT I HAD A VIRAL INFECTION. He gave me a Tylenol and sent me home. I ended up going back later that night because I had developed a high fever, headache, and my WBC counts were VERY low. I saw 10+ different doctors before they could decide if it was actually an allergy. They had to keep me for observation because they were afraid the drug was affecting my internal organs.Did it clear up the UTI? Yes. But if you can avoid the drug, I would suggest you do. If you think you are having an allergic reaction to ANY drug please don't let the doctors dismiss you! I didn't trust my gut and I just got sicker because of it.

I had a mild UTI. I went to the urgent care and was given Bactrim. I took one evening dose around 6pm and one morning does around 6am. At around 10am, I developed a severe migraine. I left work around 12:30pm, got home from work around 1:00pm, and by 2:00 I was violently throwing up. I was in the bathroom for about 3 hours - I fell asleep slumped over the toilet. I felt queasy the rest of the day as well as the following two days. For the record, I have never thrown up from a migraine before and I am not someone who throws up a lot (last time I threw up was 4-5 years prior due to food poisoning, and I threw up just once that time. The time before that was about 10 years prior to the food poisoning due to stomach flu). Even though it seemed to work, I will never take Bactrim again unless it is the only antibiotic option for something that will kill me otherwise. I felt HORRIBLE.

Been on Bactrim before and it worked but had been on daily low dose antibiotic since Keflex 11/17. Then 3 weeks ago another UTI so was put on Cipro after culture last dose Friday. Urine still cloudy  with a foul odor. Sick Sat yesterday went to ER as had  a migraine, nausea and fever. They did Computed tomography of kidneys, ureters and bladder (CT KUB)  scan and send me home on 3 weeks of this antibiotic.In pain today with fever so took Tylenol.  I am alone and dunno what to do. My doc office may be closed as i can’t figure what’s going on with their phone lines.
after completely the course of 14 tablets  800X160 DS. The symptoms did not go away.

Worst thing ever. I feel like I’m anchored to the floor, headache, feel as though my face is on fire, and it’s not helping the UTI. The kicker? Called the doctor and was told these are normal side effects and not an allergy. Never again.

I've only been in it for 3 days, I could NOT finish the 3rd day, I now have to wait 2 days to get new antibiotics because bactrim is AWFUL. I felt like I was on my death bed ever since the 3rd pill. I couldn't take my second pill for the day. Stay AWAY from septra/bactrim. Praying the infection won't worsen. I'd rather have something completely safe and will cure my infection. By the way, it did NOTHING to the infection, in fact it's gotten worse ever since I started taking it. Please DENY any prescriptions for bactrim/septra.

I have never had such a horrible experience with an antibiotic. I only took it for three days, twice a day and I was so nauseous I couldn’t eat anything, and I got so dizzy that I couldn’t even walk straight. I will never take this antibiotic again.

I was prescribed this for a rather mild UTI. I took it with a granola bar in the morning and was drinking tons of water. Within 2 hours the migraine set in, then the nausea and what felt like menstrual cramping then the body aches and chills and what I thought was a fever but was really just all my skin becoming very hot my face looked like it had a slight sun burn. I called the pharmacy and they said this was not the drug but rather symptoms of my UTI. I was so sick that I left work and went to urgent care, they re tested my urine witch now came back negative for everything and they told me to immediately discontinue taking it. The symptoms lasted well into the evening and the migraine followed me into the following day. I'm not sure if this was an allergic reaction or if I was just super sensitive to it, but it was one of the worst nights of my life. For reference I am 5"2 120lbs and was given 160mg twice daily for 3 days, and I do have a somewhat sensitive stomach.

I was given Bactrim DS twice a day for 5 days for what they thought was a UTI. I took it for 2.5 days, until they pulled me off of it because I ended up not having a UTI. I didn't have any side effects during the time I was on it. A slight dull head ache in the afternoon. I ate with it, and drank lots of water. I was warned by the pharmacist you can develop a rash; I don't believe this would have occurred for me.

I just took one 160mg tab of bactrim. This is the worse pill in history.  I got a rash,  headache, neck and back pain. Sore throat, bad. My whole body muscles  and joint are in so much pain. Nausea. My husband has to get me food,  put me in the tub to take a hot bath.  I feel so weak OMG. Fever of 101.5. which goes up and down still.  Chills and lightheaded.  The next day I still has those symptoms.  Gonna call my doc on Monday to give me a different pill. If there was a 0 rating that's what  I would give.  Thought I was gonna die.

I started this medication about 10 days ago for a UTI. First 3 days no problems in sight. No more burning when I urinate. But day 4...my face flared up like crazy with acne and burnt looking skin. I’m on my last day now and my face looks terrible! Red, flaky, acne, just bad. I am taking birth control with this since the doctor said it has no problems with it. I take birth control for hormonal acne anyway so this was fun. Helped with the UTI but all the damage it’s done it is not worth it. I’ll ask for something different next or endure the UTI.
After 6 days,  my UTI tested worse than it originally did

I took this medicine for 48 hours , I’m not a health person as it is. But this medication is horrible I can’t walk, up all night drinking water as my throat felt like it was closing. My body hurts!! I’m shaking, my blood in my body is on fire!!! Not to mention my legs feel like 250 puns waits.  I stop taking day three but still SICK!!

I’d taken this drug for a UTI about a year ago and remember feeling nauseous and dizzy but not bad enough to call the doctor. Got two doses into this round and 10 minutes after taking the second, my hands and feet itched unbearably, my lips felt swollen, I was dizzy, my heart was racing and I was getting chills and hot flashes. I ended up in the ER and was pumped full of steroids and benedryl. 9 hours now since my symptoms started and my heart is still racing. Full blown sulpha allergy.

Been taking this medication for 4 days. Been a bit nauseated. But laying down a few minutes and rinsing my face with water has helped. It is working though. UTI is basically gone. 1 more day to go. I'd say find substitutes for side effects. Drink more water, get more sleep. Your body is fighting a infection. It's bound to go out of whack. I guess the pros were worth the cons.

I’ve been on it for 3 out of 7 days, and these are my side effects:Itchy skinMigrainesJoint PainMuscle PainHorrible neck painNauseaEye irritationPinpoint red spots on skinTrouble sleepingRandom bruisingVaginal ItchingSwollen GlandsI’ve been taking leftover prescription Ibuprofen to tackle the joint/muscle/head pains, but if it wears off, I am writhing in pain. This medication, though it seems to be working on the UTI, has given me so many torturous side effects, I will NEVER use it again. As an aside, I am allergic to amoxicillin.Obviously talk to your doctor about meds, but I’d personally suggest being cautious about getting this med prescribed to you if you’ve never taken it.

Worst drug I’ve ever taken, on the third day woke up with my top lip swollen and tingling also was experiencing a sore throat, later in the day had sores all on the inside of my mouth and tongue, it’s so bad I can’t eat, swallow, drink, even hurts when I talk, throat and neck are sore.  It’s like something is eating my skin inside my mouth. I’ve never ever experienced anything like this. Why is a drug like this still on the market? Not being able to eat or drink don’t know if I can make it. My third day and still can’t eat or drink.

Asked to be prescribed this because I was prescribed it a year and a half ago for a UTI and did not have any side effects. This time around, where I am only on day two and the symptoms of the UTI have for the most part cleared, I have experienced debilitating headaches, constant fatigue, and had some anxiety yesterday morning. Luckily, I have become better with reducing my anxiety, but it does not matter how much water or food I intake, the headaches are just lingering and hover only on one side of my head over my eye. I also experienced a period of nausea so far. I am supposed to be on this for another five days and am hoping I will only need to be on for another few instead. I don't think I can complete the prescription with the borderline migraines I have been getting.

Was prescribed a seven day treatment for a UTI. On day two and the nausea is almost unbearable and I have a burning itch in my eyes and extremities (eyes are also weeping). Discontinuing med and returning to the doctor because I can’t handle the nausea and I don’t want the rash to get worse.

Was put on a 7 day regimen, 2 pills a day. My symptoms merely faded the first couple of days,  then the UTI came back  full force. After day 5, I woke up out of a dead sleep in the middle of the night with severe heart palpitations. I could literally feel my heartbeat in my throat.  Finished the 7 days and woke up to same symptoms and blood in my urine. Definitely didn't work for me and now I have to start a new antibiotic for ANOTHER week.

If you're sick, meds typically have at least one side effect you'll experience. Its a prescription drug, not a miracle homeopathic treatment found in nature. You need to follow instructions and be aware of the warnings given. Ex: DON'T DRINK ALCOHOL during the course of the med. You NEED TO EAT SOMETHING with most meds, and drinking lots of water (way more than normal) is important too. I don't eat/drink water enough on a regular basis, and I love alcohol but, if I'm on a med, I alter my lifestyle to relieve symptoms of an infection I felt were bothersome enough to go to the drs in the first place. I've had no issues with bactrim/sulfa thankfully, and those who have might want to find out if they are allergic to it prior to writing a bad review. Its a VERY common drug allergy that shouldn't sway the opinions of those not allergic. If you happen to have severe side effects from this, or any, med please find out if you are allergic first and consider it a personal learning opportunity.

Ugh... horrible! Couldn't even get through day 2. Headache, extreme nausea, and headache. This will sound weird, but my face felt "wind burned." I hope this feeling will soon be over. Not a good idea to Google symptoms either lol... good luck:) wish I had a better experience

I don't understand the bad reviews. I have been taking Bactrim since I was a kid, NEVER had a side effect and I had relieve RIGHT AWAY.UTI can cause nausea. Just take it with a lot of food & water and you be FINE!

I was having some pretty bad UTI symptoms, so I went to my local urgent care and they gave me Bactrim. Oh my goodness worst medication I’ve ever taken!! I took only one dose at the urgent care. Went home and later that night, I’d say maybe 3-4 hours in. I was so nauseous. I finally got myself to sleep, to only wake up and vomit my guts out many times. Then I wasn’t able to eat for hours. It’s been about 3 days now since I haven’t taken any medication. And my stomach is still in pain, having nausea, gagging, and not able to eat quite the same. Stay away from this drug. It’s not good. It’s very bad for your stomach. Save yourself.

Horrible! I will tell you it does work for a UTI. My UTI is almost gone, but the side effects are terrible. I was doing fine with the medication the first day and now today is my second day.Currently, I am at work jittery, having chills, I had two panic attacks and today I just started having migraines. I am only on this for three days. I have two more pills left. Tried to make it but I don't think I can handle this while working. Not so much dizziness for me just making me really tired. I will be staying on Cephalexin.

Started on Bactrim for an UTI and after 4 doses, I ended up in the ER. The doctor had thought my appendix ruptured due to the extreme pain and projectile vomiting. It wasn't my appendix, it was the Bactrim. Now, I'm under the care of a gastroenterologist due to vomiting after eating, severe stomach pain, bloating and diarrhea....2 weeks later. She's afraid it's damaged my gallbladder, but I'm currently undergoing testing. I was not on any medication, and had no health problems previously. This whole situation is a nightmare. I don't understand how this medication is still on the market.

Loved it! It did its job. On it for 10 days. This drug has been around a long time - Nurses use it all the time for "older" patients. You MUST take it properly with a disciplined regimen. 1) Take some multi-strain probiotics to add back in more good fighter bacteria. 2) Strains should include yeast to prevent yeast infection. 3) Flush (drown) your system with water - shoot for 12 8oz glasses a day. Add lemon to some of the water for kidney health. 4) Take psylliym fiber, prune juice when necessary. Your gut will be very unbalanced while the army of good and army of bad are fighting and you won't know how many "soldiers" you have on each side at any given time.

I strongly advise against taking this drug. Many people do not know that this drug has been banned in the UK due to the amount of people that died from it or contracted Steven Johnson Syndrome, which is characterized by your skin falling off. I was prescribed Bactrim for a UTI. Clearly, there were a lot of other options to prescribe a small, 100 pound girl with a minor infection. However, the doctor chose this drug. I took 3 pills out of the 14 that I was given and I had such a severe migraine that I could not open my eyes or chew food. The pain eventually went into my neck and that is when I stated to panic - called doc and was told I had an allergic reaction and stopped taking it immediately.

I was scared to death to take this medication. I got the Bactrim on a Friday night and didn't have the courage to take it until Sunday night. The horror stories I read about it almost gave me panic attack just thinking about the what if's. Luckily I haven't had any side effects other than my lips burned a bit after the first dose and I was jittery.  I am sure to eat a full meal before taking the dose.

I had a bad UTI and I have taken this in the past and I am now taking it again. I get 4-7 days depending on doctor. It almost always clears it up. If you don't eat like I do then you can get nauseated if you take it on an empty stomach. The pill is huge so I chew it and use a spoon of yogurt and eat it down like that. I wish they made chewable versions or coated versions as it's hard to take but I do take it! The pill is a miracle worker and helps me greatly.

Was prescribed two pills per day for seven days.  I could already tell about 5 hours after I took my first dose that my UTI symptoms had improved.  Not miraculously, but enough to give me some relief.  I went and got some Azo too, but ended up not needing to take it because the Bactrim started to help pretty quickly.  I've taken three doses now, and my symptoms are MUCH improved.  I will of course continue the full course to make sure the infection is knocked out completely.I haven't really experienced any side effects at all.  I think if you follow the instructions to a "T" you will have much fewer, if any, side effects.  Take the pill with a meal and at least one full glass of water, then water all day long.  It works!

No health insurance. Went to the ER for UTI and was prescribed Bactrim. UTI symptoms quickly subsided (didn't disappear completely but like 90% better) so that was nice. Then the Bactrim symptoms started. Oh man. I had a different set of symptoms every day. First it was tingly hands and severe fatigue. Then I had a full blown panic attack (depression and anxiety can be made worse by Bactrim apparently so I tried to keep reminding myself of that). Last couple of days I've had headaches and bad nausea. I'm on day 6 of my 7 day course now-- gonna try my best to make it through the whole course but wowww it's tough. I just hope these symptoms clear up once my pills are gone. It got its job done but made me miserable in the process!

I'm on my 4th day of the dosage. Since day one of taking it I started vomiting a couple hours of the dose. Been like that ever since, vomiting and diarrhea all day.  Today I started eating yogurt after taking it on recommendation of the pharmacist. It has helped some and cut down the severely and frequency of the vomiting  and diarrhea but hasn't eliminated it. Can't wait to reach day 7 to be done.. I called the doctor, only thing he said was I had to keep taking it or I'd be admitted to hospital. Screw that I'll deal with the stomach issues. Good luck to you if prescribed it and try the yogurt it helps. BTW, pepto will make you immediately puke if you try to take some while on bactrim. I dunno why, but from my personal experience it does, beware!

Got a pretty nasty UTI ... I've had them before so I knew the drill. Went to the Dr. The infection was confirmed. He prescribed Bactrim DS, twice a day for 7 days. I read the information provided by the pharmacist so I knew what to look for in case of a problem & took the first dose. I did have a few side effects, dizziness, mild nausea, and my blood sugar was off, but the infection felt better by the end of day 1. I can deal with mild side effects if it means fixing a larger problem. Pros & cons to everything! I would take it again if needed.

This is my first time commenting on any medicine. Anyways I almost didn't even take this medicine because all of the bad reviews but thank God I did!!! Please don't let these negative comments stop you from taking this medicine. The ONLY side effect I currently have is a bit of nausea and that's only because I do not eat much as I am on a calorie restricted diet. Maybe these people are having bad reactions because of an allergy to sulfa drugs or it is just the symptoms of the really bad UTI .  IDK....I'm on these pills and have 1 more day left and it has brought my kidney pain down tremendously. I usually react badly to antibiotics but not these so thumbs up!
UTI turned into kidney infection then into severe sepsis which is infection of the blood. 4 Days in the hospital on continuous antibiotics. Went home with Bactrim for 7 days. No side effects at all.

Bactrim has always worked for my UTI. I do see a pattern in the complaints about. The bottle doesn't say not to consume. If you mix bactrim with the smallest sip of wine you will get those side effects that I see mentioned. If you take bactrim do not consume any wine, beer, or hard liquor.

The first day, I experienced some nausea. Now? I have a sore in my mouth that popped up out of nowhere and one side of my bottom lip is swollen. I'm so sick that I can't eat anything and have zero appetite. I keep getting the shakes and chills that weren't there before starting it. I suffer from anxiety and anxiety is a common side effect with this medication - so now my anxiety is through the roof and it's also caused severe insomnia. I'm constipated, have terrible muscle spasms and cramps in my legs. I've never had an issue with a sulfa drug before but after this I will definitely not take one ever again. It's not worth the side effects/allergic reaction

I had a UTI finished an entire prescription of macrobid. I noticed as soon as I finished the meds my UTI symptoms came back - so it didn't work for m.  I then tried bactrim. The pain went away after 1.5 days of being on bactrim which was a huge relief but it is now day 4 and I am suffering from nausea, cold sweats, chills, insomnia and anxiety. It works for your UTI but the side effects are unbearable after a few days.

Had a severe UTI that wouldn't clear up on it's own so I had a doctor that called in Bactrim. Within 15 minutes of taking it I had severe flu-like symptoms. It is now 3 years later ... I can only eat about 10 different foods due to intolerances and severe allergies to most anything. I cannot tolerate chemicals or outside allergens either. I basically live in a bubble- of pain, fatigue and misery. When people ask what happened to me, all I can say is, I don't know, I took Bactrim and it ruined my immune system. Did the Bactrim clear up the infection? Yep... sure did.

Bactrum did help my infection pretty quickly. HOWEVER, it is one month since I took the last dose and I still have major insomnia. Some nights I don't sleep at all others just a few hours . I would never take this drug again, ever!!!

Prostate UTI asked not to be given Cipro as it can cause permanent tendon damage if you are doing repetitive movements. See CBC news article. They gave bactrim. It's a poor substitute. Dizzy, tired, dry eyes, damn slow working. On day 4 of 7 not much better. Cipro is the one of choice for prostate in my experience to work well but it has it's side effects too.

I don't know what is it with all these users reporting ineffectiveness or side effects.  Maybe mostly people who have complaints are the ones who take the trouble to write reviews. I had a UTI, and a few hours after taking the first pill of Bactrim my symptoms started to clear. On my third pill now and no side effects and starting to feel better than I have in weeks.

Prescribed generic Bactrim DS, 2x/day for 3 days. Just took my last dose and minimal side effects. I always ate a big substantial meal before taking this medication even though I had loss of appetite (ate food that had tons of starch). Also, drank tons of water after and throughout the day. I was constantly peeing but at least I knew I was drinking enough. Had minor upset stomach and fatigue but still very functional esp when the pain from UTI was gone. Took a day and half to feel relief.

I was given Bactrim for a UTI in November 2016. On day 2 my entire lower half of my body became numb. And I mean all of it including the female parts. I was convinced I had MS, Lou Gehrig disease, or even piraformis nerve entrapment. I looked them all up and never in a million years thought it was related to the antibiotic, never even crossed my mind. Nothing made sense that was happening to me. I had to hold onto walls to walk and the nerve and numbness pain was unbelievable. I had no insurance so really never got checked out. When my mom randomly said her friend had a terrible reaction to this drug I started reading. I put it all together and all of my symptoms are because of this. It is now February and I have 80% of feeling back. But still not in female area or left foot but am hopeful I will continue to improve but takes a LONG time. This is the worst experience I have ever gone thru in my life. And, I HAD taken this drug before so you never know.

I would not recommend this to ANYONE. I have had bleeding in my urine for over two weeks and the doctors associated it with a UTI. After being given macrobid, and symptoms persisting they gave me septa. I took it for two days twice a day with food was fine, on the third day not so much. I began shaking uncontrollably, dry mouth, I was incoherent to the point I couldn't even understand what people were saying to me, heart was racing, I was dizzy, and extremely nauseous. It literally felt like I had been roofied (drugged up) . I don't even remember half the night and I had horrible insomnia. I don't even understand how this is on the market. Would never EVER take this again.

I was prescribed Bactrim DS for a severe UTI and 7 day twice a day schedule. On the second day of dosage, I began having Flu-like symptoms such as dizzy spells, nausea, aches, weakness, and I felt so sick, I thought I was going to die. I felt worse each day and by the 6th day of dosage, I had to return to my doctor. He said I must have had a severe allergy to this medicine. He gave me a shot of antibiotics and prescription of 500 MG Amoxicillin. I am finally feeling better. The Bactrim did not work on me. They put a note in my chart to not prescribe Bactrim to me again. I think that some people have allergies to this, I know I do. Hope my story helps you.
I have taken this medicine off and on many times, works wonders, I always have refills if it comes back!  It's definitely my go to!

I had UTI, usually it goes away with OTC Azo and water, but this time I could not get rid of it. So I went to the ER. They gave me Bactrim. 2 a day for 5 days. I took the entire round of them and nothing changed. The medicine itself made me sick as a dog. I could eat with it or not eat with it and it didn't matter. I was still so nauseous. It gave me chills and made me dizzy as well. I wouldn't give this to my worst enemy!

Had a bladder infection that I ignored, turned into a very painful kidney infection. Got a,3 day supply of generic bactrim. Took first pill by 10am with a ton of water throughout the day. Went to bed all day except to pee 100 times and I was amazed that I felt way better by the next morning.

Just got prescribed this drug yesterday. 2 a day for 3 days. Took my first dose in the morning and the second at night, I fell asleep soon after. A few hours later I was woken up with terrible stomach pain and serious nausea. I ended up vomiting several times. After, it felt a little better but then the pains came right back and nausea persists. Cant sleep, don't think I want to deal with another night of this, hate this medication

I got this bactrim dm antibiotic prescribed to me for prostatitis/ uti symptoms not to long ago.. I took the medication twice a day for about a month!!! Some days were better then others.. if i would take it with an empty stomach and not enough water to swallow the big chunky tablet my lips would feel some kind of burning sensation going on and I would just feel kind of itchy all over. If I would take it with food and about two glasses of water I'd be perfectly fine! Anyways I don't know why but even after a month of taking the medication twice a day everyday, my uti symptoms are still their! They're not as bad as they were before I started taking the antibiotics.. but they're some what still noticeable.. grrrrrrr!

I had 3 UTIs this year so far, first in February, got cephalexin prescribed, for 7 days .. It returned in June, got prescribed ciprofloxacin for 5 days... It had returned in August... I asked the doctor why this is happening?? She said they prescribed me the wrong drug at first time, the first drug was resistant to the bacteria I had. (Really? Why do we pay doctors for???) so i got Bactrim DS prescribed now, I'm on day 3, got for 5 days. I weight 100 pounds, so I try to take the pill with activitia and yakult, that helps with the upset stomach. I felt as side effects, dry mouth (because dehydrate you), loss of appetite, tiredness, fast heart beating. Hope this works for me, can't be sick anymore because of doctor mistake!!!

This antibiotic did horrible for me, it gives me bad migraines even though i drink a ton of water with it, I'm on the second day and have a horrible migraine my spine hurts to walk, server leg cramps, joint pain too.. it's awful.. i will know now to never take this again... my body did not react well. the side effects are not worth it... next time i will be sure to tell my doctor to never prescribe me this again!

Took 1 dose (first dose) at 6am on a tuesday. By 8am throat was sore. 9am feet went numb and started feeling odd, throat hurt more as well. By 11 am feet were red and raw and hurt like nails poking through them. Genitals became beat red and raw! Had a fever and loss of appetite.  Did not take anymore after first dose. Thursday feet were better but still had sore throat and genitals still raw and felt nauseous. Friday still sore throat, genitals not as red or raw but developed a hive on them. It's now Saturday and still have sore throat, color is back to normal on genitals but still have hive and now another in the pubic hair area. I'm kinda freaking out now and probably go back to he doctor today. All this from one damn pill! Uti still there

Started this med yesterday for the first time.  Immediately noticed how strong it is!  Prevented vomiting by only taking on a full stomach.  Drinking a lot of water will help with the headaches as dehydration will cause this too.  I don't recommend taking too late at night because of insomnia.
Bactrim has always worked to clear up my uti infections. I have never had any bad experiences with this drug. I love it  800/120 twice a day for 5 days is what has worked for me.

This is an amazing drug, I've never had any side effects besides that one where my bladder infection went away, if your reading people's posts who have horrible side effects they probably have an easily upset stomach. Don't eat or drink water. In most people these don't cause side effects when properly taken. Or allergic! I wouldn't be too worried.

I was scared to take this because I read about people having horrifying side effects...I'm taking the generic form of Bactrim DS 2x a day for 7 days. On day 5 and the only side effects I've noticed are mild gas and a headache. If you're skimming these reviews looking for reasons to be scared, just remember that most of these bad reviews are from people who are probably: A) Allergic to the medicine. B) Not drinking enough water. C) Using alcohol and non-prescription drugs which you are NOT supposed to do while on Bactrim. D) Not taking it with food. Take the medicine with food and a good probiotic and it will help minimize your side effects. Drink LOTS of water and stay out of the sun while on this medicine! Not soda, not coffee, WATER.

This is day 2 taking this med. It makes me very queasy and very tired. The nausea and tiredness start about 30 minutes after I take one, and seem to last for 6 or 7 hours. I try to take it with food, but I don't have much appetite  (not gonna be mad about that tho). The uti seems pretty much gone, but I'm also taking Azo.

This was amazing! I had my first UTI this morning I had frequency and irritation after I urinated. I took Bactrum about an hour ago and I'm was in so much pain until a couple minutes age when the medicine kicked in! I feel so much relief and I have less urge to go! UTIs are terrible and I'm so sorry for everyone who has gotten one but I'm also glad that there is medication to treat it and that it works this fast!!!

Hey you, yeah, you reading this review. Take a breath. If you're speeding through all of these experiences, you're probably looking for potential side effects and reactions of other people. I know, because I'm just like you.I can tell you the first day I took Bactrim, I had a horrible migraine. The worst I've had in months. But guess what--I also didn't drink coffee that day after having a constant intake for weeks. I had other problems like chills, but wait, I got this medicine for an infection! So many symptoms people experience are likely a result of other things.  My uti went away. I drank lots of water and milk with it. Other than experiencing a few more headaches, and a bit of tiredness, I was fine.

Worked after three does, but that is when the headache started. No relief from headache with Tylenol or Motrin.  I'm going to ask dr. For different drug. Also seemed to get chapped lips, dry hands, and did get low blood sugar accompanied by sweating on third day on this medicine. UTI seems to be cured though.
I have been on bactrim for the last 3 days and on the fourth pill and its done nothing for me

I went to the Dr and was prescribed Bactrim for a urinary tract infection. I initially took it on a empty stomach which was a mistake. Taking it with food, even crackers, prevents nausea, and most other side effects. I am on my 3rd full day of taking it and I have no relief from my symptoms. I'm waiting for my culture to come back and will call my Dr for something else if necessary.

Knocked UTI symptoms out effectively after the first 24 hours. However, the side effects were not pleasant and were very noticeable: headache, nausea, dizziness, light-headed, weakness, sweating, dry mouth, excessive thirst, tiredness. I'm on day 3 and have asked the doc to switch me to something else so I can function better at home and work. Trying Cipro. Be sure to drink water constantly when on Bactrim DS.

Was on cipro for a week but no relief so my doctor switched me to this drug. Felt relief within 72 hours. I had extreme nausea and a headache the first day I took this drug but then I started to take it with meals and I haven't had those side effects.

only took the medication for 5 days, had read about it online after being prescribed it and got really worried at all the awful side affects. I experienced nausea and headaches and slight itchiness while on it and was glad to finally get off of it. It is my 3rd day off of it and the itching has got worse and all over now. I only have a few tiny redish bumps though and I am experiencing anxiety on and off randomly and just feel weird  and have also caught a cold (sore throat/cough). will never take this medication ever again and I severely advise against it.

Im currently taking bactrim for a UTI. It relieved my symptoms rather quickly however the side effects are really bothering me. I've had the most painful migraines since taking it yesterday. I also have the chills and slight nausea. I wont take this medicine ever again once I finish it. The constant painful headaches are not worth it.

Having a horrible experience on Bactrim. This antibiotic should come with a warning label. Urinary symptoms have not been relieved yet (going on 3rd day). Experiencing severe nausea and diarrhea. Zofran helps somewhat. I don't know that I can continue this medication for 3 more days.

I have been taking bactrim now for about a week n a half for a uti, and mrsa. I am sure it's workin because the kidney pain has subsided however the nausea is so crucial it's like the worst nausea I've ever had in my life. Not to mention headache and chills. Ugh I don't know if it's worth it

So, I wanted to review this drug because I've been on five antibiotic treatments within the last month and a half for the craziest UTI I've ever experienced in my life. Landed in the ER for fevers and pain and worst was the mental confusion.... Anyways, during  this time I've been on IV antibiotics, Z pak as well as  Keflex, which gave me horrible anxiety and extreme photo sensitivity. When I tried levaquin, it sent me to the ER. Then finally bactrim DS was prescribed. After taking it the first night I did have some trouble sleeping but after two doses of the medication I did adjust. I have been taking probiotics with these meds. It's helped overall. Side effects I noted vivid dreams, fatigue, and constipation were the main three.
Had no negative side effects. Got rid of my UTI fast.

I have been suffering with a UTI for at least a month and a half, I have been prescribed nitrofurantonin and Cipro 2 times...with those drugs I had still had the urge to urinate and immediately when I stopped those two antibiotics the symptoms came right back. Doctors were getting ready to send me to a urologist until I mentioned bactrim. After one dose of the antibiotic I was feeling 80% better. I haven't had any side effects yet and its day 2...These drug is God sent!

I got my first UTI 5 days ago but thought it was just a yeast infection. So I used yeast infection medicine until my lower abdomin hurt so bad and it was impossible to urinate, even though I had the constant urge to go. I was miserable. Went to ER Sunday evening around 6 and was sent home with Bactrim DS and Pyridium. Within hours I could urinate better and within 12 hours I had no abdominal pain and could urinate just fine and completely empty my bladder. And that was after just 1 dose. I'm so grateful for this antibiotic and think it's wonderful. I did get a slight headache but it was definately worth it.

I'm 21 years old with my first UTI. My symptoms started on Saturday (constant urge to go, lower abdominal pressure/cramps, and an extremely uncomfortable urge to continue voiding even after I was done, and dark yellow/brown urine) went to the doctor yesterday(Wednesday) and was prescribed a 7 day prescription to bactrim. My symptoms seemed to dissipate within hours (was still feeling them just not as severe) I've taken 3 doses and all my symptoms have stopped and I can have full voids. Not feeling any side effects From the medication, but glad to be feeling better. Urine was still sent in for a culture. Been drinking lots of cranberry juice and water at my doctors recommendation to "flush" everything out. Feel much better
Bactrim helped with my bladder infection symptoms, but I have had the worst headache for three days straight from it. It hurts so bad that I've been nauseous. I hope I never have to take this again.

It's my 4th day on Bactrim and it has not been great. I feel better from the overall symptoms but I've been fatigued and super groggy and for the first day I had a horrible headache. I keep feeling my heart pounding in my head and ears, but I agree with pretty much everyone else on here, the symptoms from the cure are better than the symptoms of my bladder/kidney infection. I've got 6 more days... Is it effective? Yes. Is it an enjoyable experience? No.

I took a form of this medication a couple of years ago (Septra, which has the same ingredients) and it cleared up my UTI, although I thought it was a little slow to fully work. So when I got a UTI about a week ago suddenly, I asked my doc to prescribe it for me again, only this time it was Bactrim. I'm funny with antibiotics, I don't like taking them and I have a very sensitive stomach, so I like to stick with what works. Took it again this time, and noticed my symptoms improved, then got bad again. I had two side effects this time, loss of appetite and jittery feeling. I went back to my doc and my urine sample still showed white blood cells, so they sent my sample out to be cultured for a better prescription. It helped but didn't cure it.

It didn't work it gave me a cold and headaches and severe cough and a yeast infection, it's day 7 of 10 and I have NO RELEIF. I do not recommend this. Maybe it just doesn't work for me I don't know. I don't think I'd ever use it again.

it is important to know medications affect everyone differently Your genetic chemical makeup is not the same as sue or bill. FYI you are encouraged to drink lots of water when taking Bactrim not everyone will have the same symptoms it is a sulfa drug so if you have an allergy to Sulfa drugs then you might want to tell your doctor let him know and they can prescribe you something else only thing I've had symptom wise with bactrim is a headache  and ibuprofen will normally help with the body aches and headache but if you are having any adverse reaction it's a good idea to let your physician or pharmacy know. Zofran is good for nausea and benedryl may be effective with hives or rash but if you have any concerns please consult a medical profes

I have had these urinary tract infections and the only thing that works quickly is the Bactrim DS. It works in a matter of days. Side effects are different for everyone but as mild as mine have been I would choose this over any other antibiotic. Very happy! Make sure that you always take the full dose and the whole bottle as prescribed even though it feels like it's going away. best wishes!
For those that are experiencing headaches and nausea, drink a glass of milk before taking Bactrim.  This always works for me.
This made my very sick to my stomach. I couldn't even finish the bottle. I stopped the day before yesterday and still have severe nausea and insomnia. I just want to feel better!

I have reoccuring UTI's and have taken several different antibiotics for them.  I was recently prescribed Bactrim DS.  After taking the second pill, the aching, pain and soreness was almost gone.  It works better for me than Cipro, but you should always have a urine culture to be sure which antibiotic is best for you.  Fortunately, I haven't had any terrible side effects.  The only side effect is feeling a bit fatiqued a few hours after taking Bactrim.
Worked after one dose. High dose of 3 strong pills once only. But today I feel lightheaded, dizzy and low appetite.
Taken this medicine for urinary tract infection. Pain stopped after taking medicine 1 day. Side effects on day 3 horrible. ..weakness, bad nausea, lightheaded, loss of appetite, and headache.

I used to get recurrent urinary tract infections but hadn't had one in 7 years. Just got one and they tried nitrofurantonin but it did nothing. I got Bactrim and the urgency and burning was gone within hours. I don't like taking antibiotics but UTIs are no joke. Bactrim worked for me and thank goodness. I get a little stomach ache but it beats the UTI symptoms!

Felt mild relief, Doc said it should be gone in 3 days gave me enough to take it for 5 days in case it was not gone. I also experienced fevers and achiness. Not pleasant. Everyday I had discomfort and today I am out of it and feel terrible with my urinary tract symptoms again.

Make sure Bactrim is actually the correct medication for your UTI! I took Bactrim for 4 days with no relief before my doctor's office got the results back from my UA and realized that Bactrim is resistant to the bacteria causing my UTI. Now I am taking Cipro and it seems to be doing the trick. I did not have any side effects with Bactrim though, it just didn't work for me.

Bactrim did a great job! My whole lower part of the body hurt and burned, it was awful. I couldn't even walk for a while without feeling strong pain. Going to the toilet was a nightmare and it happened every five minutes. I took Bactrim and the symptoms got worse, but then in two days I was cured. no pain, no nothing. Bactrim is perfect.

I have frequent urinary tract infections and I've taken this many times but hadn't in five or so years because my urinary tract infection became resistant to it. Now since I'm taking it again its given me the jitters and acid reflux but those are still better that cystitis.

Had a 7 day prescription of Bactrim DS. The first two days I had a headache, then the 3rd day I started feeling nausea which turned into nausea/dizziness/and constant fatigue. I've been off the medicine for 36 hours and still feel extremely exhausted, and still dizzy and a little queasy at times.

I asked my doctor for a different type of antibiotic to take for this urinary tract infection instead of Cipro. This is my second day taking Bactrim for my UTI and I can already see improvement! It feels like the infections almost gone. I do however get a little bit of an upset stomach so eat something substantial just before taking it and drink a few more bottles of water than normal and you will be golden!

Third day of medicine but still having symptoms. Those of you who report adverse reactions and then go on taking the medicine should know that is not a good idea. I am allergic to several antibiotics, and my doc says stop taking at the first sign of any reaction as it can be very serious.

I have been on Bactrim DS for 7 days. After day 3 I began to notice severe headache about 4 hours after taking the Bactrim. Now on day 7, I have not only had headache, but light-headedness/nausea. With only 3 days left, I am going to continue the medicine. My urinary tract infection symptoms have improved finally after 5 days.

I also had similar experiences and side effects like lethargy, shaking, confusion slightly, severe fatigue, headaches, aches and pains, but kept taking the medicine anyway because the pain of a urinary tract infection is much much worse. I'd rather suffer for a short time with these symptoms then suffer with a bladder infection.

Used this medication for three days. It appeared to work well until my urinary tract infection returned a week after I finished the medication.  My doctor then prescribed Cipro.  My fingers are crossed, praying this cures it.

I have bad side effects from all antibiotics, which is why I ended up with a long-standing urinary tract infection. I was given Bactrim DS by my doctor. I was really afraid to take this medications, so I cut a pill in half. I also took 1/4 of a Phenergan to help with possible nausea. I was fine all day. No side effects at all until about 4 hours in. Then I developed extreme body aches, especially stiff neck and a low grade fever (which lasted 3 days). I didn't take another one, checked my urine with a dipstick and it was clear. Unfortunately the urinary tract infection came back the next day because I didn't take enough. I tried 1/4 of a pill and had the same side effects 4 hours later. No more of those for me. Going back to the doctor for something else.

Received a seven day prescription for Bactrim and on the 5th day lost appetite, had terrible body aches, and extreme fatigue. On the 6th day, had a fever, and chills too. Stopped the treatment on the 7th day.  Then on the evening of the 8th day developed a rash all over my upper body and face.  Pharmacist recommend Benadryl which helped somewhat.  Having a urinalysis in a week and surely hope it worked and cleared up my urinary tract infection.
Bad adverse reactions: heart racing, low blood pressure, kidney and bladder pain, severe nausea, shaking so that I could not drive, fatigue, blurred vision . Rash came out after I went off the drug.

I'm very obsessive. Somewhere around a few years ago I started obsessing and being paranoid about medications. So, as I'm sure you are all doing right now, you're looking up reviews on this medication to determine if you'll take it. Just like I did. I almost gave myself a panic attack thinking about possibly taking this medicine and then having a serious allergic reaction.Luckily though, while speaking with my pharmacist he let me know I took this medicine last year and I remembered I was fine.The point is, every medicine has adverse effects. Chances are, you won't have major side effects.

Have a persistent urinary tract infection and took this medication about four weeks ago.  The urinary tract infection came back so a second go-around.  This time after one pill I had a hefty case of hives and a very sore tongue and headache for about two days.

This medicine improved the quality of my life. I have interstitial cystitis. I have to use this twice a day for 20 years. It's hard when I change doctors to get it prescribed but I always get it. I would not live with the pain of this disease if it was not for this medicine.

Took this for 3 days. 2nd day got severe itching on palms and soles of feet. Day three had uncontrollable shakes, heart racing, felt like it was going to come out of my chest, facial numbness, dizzy, very elevated (for me) blood pressure of 145/90, whole body tingling, dizziness, light headed, extremely intense nervousness, ringing in my ears.

Taking Bactrim for urinary tract infection, can't sleep, stomach on fire, after first pill I felt like I was tripping on acid. On day three now and back hurts. Looks like I get to miss another day of work and go back to doctor.

I have taken it before and it seemed to clear my urinary tract infection up well.  However, this last time after my first pill (in the afternoon), I felt flushed, bad headache, chills, some pain inhaling breaths, and facial swelling the morning when I woke up though it went down quickly.

I've just taken my 3rd pill and everytime I take it I feel extremely lousy.  Terrible headaches, dizziness, blurry vision, shaky nervousness, some difficulty breathing, beginning to itch.  I don't like this at all the way I feel.  Just before I need to take the next dose I'm feeling my old normal self and then I take the Bactrim and boom I go downhill, again.  Told my doctor I quit...it's ruining the quality of my life.

Little did I know, I am horribly allergic to Sulfa.  After two pills, I began experiencing horrible leg and arm cramps.  They were so bad, that I was unable to stand for longer than a couple of minutes.  These symptoms took about a week to fully disappear and this was from taking only 2 pills!
I had a terrible urinary tract infection. Went to the ER and they gave me this anti-biotic. It made me really sick.

Any antibiotic used will put you at risk for a yeast infection. It depletes the normal flora in the vaginal area. Bactrim DS is a great antibiotic to get rid of many forms of infection though. Weigh your pros and cons. You can always add yogurt to your diet which assists in helping to prevent yeast infections.

I get bladder infections a lot so I have a standing script for them but my Doctor said to only use them until symptoms were gone. It works wonderful fast no side effects. My urinary tract infections are usually gone in 3 days and better in one.
It worked like magic on my urinary tract infection. It is great and I didn't have any side effects.
Worked well but caused me to have acid reflux.
Worked fast. Thank goodness.
Works well for me but also gave me yeast infections.
Works really well, but I also had some side effects.
Helped clear out a urinary tract infection fast. Still took the medication for a full week. It really did the trick.
